Description: A copper bracelet: made from two strands of wire, twisted together to produce a decorative spiral pattern.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Faras (Nubia), Protodynastic cemetery Grave 3/31 Found on the right wrist.
Curator's comments: Also form this burial: anklet (1912,1109.30), beads (1912,1109.31 & 1912,1109.32 & 1912,1109.33), necklace (1912,1109.29), shell (1912,1109.28). Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 15 and pl. IV, 10. For the occurrence of copper bracelets in Early Dynastic Nubia, see I. Hofmann, 'Die Kulturen des Niltals', 92, 97, with the references there given; also H. Åke-Nordstrom, ‘The Scandinavian Joint Expedition to Sudenese Nubia’: vols. 3:1 ‘Neolithic and A-group Sites’ (Stockholm, 1972), 127 and 3:2, pls.54 C, 196, (1).
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (152)
